name: code-template-tool
description: Generate code based on the template

codeTemplateTool.templatesPath.description:
Absolute path only. 
Variables supported: 
 1. `{home}`: User home directory. 
 2. `{workspace}`: Workspace directory(directory currently open in vscode) or user home directory if no open directory. 
 Examples: `{home}/.vscode/templates`, `{workspace}/templates`. 
You can also use `~/` to reference user home directory.

codeTemplateTool.ignore.description: An array of glob patterns. Files and folders that match one of the specified patterns will be ignored.

codeTemplateTool.variable.noTransformati.description: Control variable transformation globally. If set to true, raw user input will be used to replace the placeholders in template content. Can be overwritten by the `style.noTransformation` filed in variable configuration.

codeTemplateTool.variable.keepUpperCase.description: If set to `true`, uppercase words in user input variable value will not be transformed to other cases. Can be overwritten by the `style.keepUpperCase` field in variable configuration.

codeTemplateTool.variable.leftBoundary.description: The default value is for compatibility. If using variable in file names, the boundary token should not be reserved characters of your operating system. Examples: `{_`, `{{`, `{%`

codeTemplateTool.variable.rightBoundary.description: The default value is for compatibility. If using variable in file names, the boundary token should not be reserved characters of your operating system. Examples: `_}`, `}}`, `%}`

codeTemplateTool.variable.styleBoundary.description: The style boundary in the template, eg: {{name:caseStyle}}

codeTemplateTool.userInput.confirmOnEnte.description: If set to `true`, you can press `enter` key to `confirm`.

codeTemplateTool.userInput.cancelOnEscap.description: If set to `true`, you can press `esc` key to `cancel`.

scripts.test: npm run lint:fix && npm run compile && node ./node_modules/vscode/bin/test
scripts.format: npm run prettier && npm run lint:fix
